title: Why was David anointed 3 times before he became king of Israel? - Quora

response.answer_text: Romans 8:30 (NKJV) Moreover whom He predestined, these He also called; whom He called, these He also justified; and whom He justified, these He also glorified. CALLED 1 Samuel 16.13 “ So Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the presence of his brothers, and form that day in the Spirit of the Lord came powerfully upon David. Samuel then went to Ramah.” JUSTIFIED 2 Samuel 2:4 “Then the men of Judah came to Hebron, and there they anointed David king over the tribe of Judah. When David was told that it was the men from Jabesh Gilead who had buried Saul GLORIFIED 2 Samuel 5:1-5 1.“ All the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron and said,” We are your own flesh and blood. In the past, while Saul was king over us, you were the one who led Israel on their military campaigns. And the Lord said to you, ´You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will become their ruler.´”3. When all the elders of Israel had come to King David at Hebron, the king made a covenant with them at Hebron before the Lord, and they anointed David king over Israel. 4. David was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned forty years. 5. In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned over all Israel and Judah thirty-three years.”

Because David had a very slow rise to power. Neither was he in any rush to claim his kingdom. He waited for the Lord to direct him. The first anointing was a private ( secret to king Saul ) anointing. Saul remained King for a decade or more, after David was first anointed (1 Samuel 16:13–14). The second partial (2 Samuel 2:1–4). Even the death of King Saul didn’t leave the way clear for David to ascend the throne as the Lord’s anointed king. It took Abner, Saul’s army general some time and a civil war to acknowledge that the Lord had promised David to be king and clear the way for it to happen. The third anointing was complete 2 Samuel 5:3.
